org.example.validation.analyzers

Interface AnnotationAnalyzer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CardNumberAnalyzer, EmailAnalyzer, NotNullAnalyzer, PasswordAnalyzer, PhoneNumberAnalyzer, ThreadSafeAnalyzer, ValidateAnalyzer

    public interface AnnotationAnalyzer
    This is a common interface for analyzers. Each specific implementation will in its own way check for validity of fields marked with different annotations
    See Also:
    CardNumberAnalyzer, EmailAnalyzer, NotNullAnalyzer, PasswordAnalyzer, PhoneNumberAnalyzer, ThreadSafeAnalyzer, ValidateAnalyzer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.lang.Object[] convert(java.lang.reflect.Field field, java.lang.Object o, MapTarget target) 
      default java.lang.String printPlace(java.lang.reflect.Field field, java.lang.Object obj) 
      void recursive(java.lang.Object[] array, java.lang.String name) 
      boolean validate(java.lang.reflect.Field field, java.lang.Object obj) 

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        boolean validate(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                 java.lang.Object obj)
        Parameters:
        field - annotated field
        obj - the object of the class that this field belongs to
        Returns:
        True, if the field is valid according to the annotation, otherwise false This method checks the validity of a field marked with one of the library annotations.

      • recursive

        void recursive(java.lang.Object[] array,
               java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        array - an array of objects to be checked recursively according to the annotation (for example, array, list, set, or map)
        name - the name of the field required to enter information about it and the number of its element in the resulting list in case of failure.
        See Also:
        Results

      • convert

        default java.lang.Object[] convert(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                   java.lang.Object o,
                                   MapTarget target)
        Parameters:
        field - annotated field
        o - the object of the class that this field belongs to
        target - If the object is a map, this object must be marked by MapTarget.KEYS or MapTarget.VALUES (that is, according to the annotation, we must check either the keys or the values)
        Returns:
        converted array of objects from collection, list, set or map
        See Also:
        MapTarget, recursive(Object[], String)

      • printPlace

        default java.lang.String printPlace(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                    java.lang.Object obj)
        Parameters:
        field - invalid field
        obj - the object of the class that this field belongs to
        Returns:
        message about a mismatch of a given field in a given class
        See Also:
        ValidationResult
